entries.english: Singular (Nĩĩ): Njũkaga (I come), Nđĩraga (I cry), Nđĩaga (I eat), Njaragia (I speak), Ngenaga (I am usually happy), Thekaga (I laugh), Thiaga (I go), Thomaga (I read). Plural (Ithuĩ): Tũkaga (we come), Tũrĩraga (we cry), Tũrĩaga (we eat), Twaragia (we speak), Tũkenaga (we are happy), Tũthekaga (we laugh), Tũthiaga (we go), Tũthomaga (we read), Tũanđĩkaga (we write)

Now (Kahinda gaka/rĩu): Nđĩ gũkũ (I am here), Twĩ gũkũ (we are here), Wĩ gũkũ (you are here), Mwĩ gukũ (you all are here), E gũkũ (he/she is here), Me gũkũ (they are here). Earlier today (ũmũthĩ mahinda mahitũku): Nyuma gũkũ, Tuma gũkũ, Uma gũkũ, Muma gũkũ, Oima gũkũ, Moima gũkũ

examples.english: We are here and we're eating meat
We were here earlier and we ate meat

entries.english: Ĩno nĩ Nyaga (This is an ostrich) - Nĩ ũrĩ wona Nyaga? (Have you ever seen an ostrich?). Ĩno nĩ Huria (This is a rhino) - Nĩ marĩ mona huria? (Have they ever seen a rhino?). Ũyũ nĩ mũrũthi (This is a lion) - Nĩ mũrĩ mwona mũrũthi? (Have you all ever seen a lion?)
